intro: Rhynchospora aristata var. fuertesii, commonly known as the Fuertes' spikegrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
